title: Washington and Photo on Education - development

content.question: Which of the following best explains the development of Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs)?

choices.label: Government support for racially equal education led to the creation of universities using public funding.
Educational discrimination after the American Civil War led African Americans to found their own colleges rather than attending white universities.
Racial tensions in post-Civil War America required African Americans to fund the creation of HBCUs with little help from white citizens.
Religious concerns about Black education led to the development of HBCUs as entirely secular schools for Black students.

content.answer: Educational discrimination after the American Civil War led African Americans to found their own colleges rather than attending white universities.
